Class ObjectQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • ObjectQueue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ObjectQueueInterface

    public class ObjectQueue
extends java.lang.Object
implements ObjectQueueInterface
    Handles the data structure of queues. Takes in generic objects for maximum capabilities.
    Author:
    Richard Stegman

        Clears out the queue and sets its state back to new.
        Specified by:
        clear in interface ObjectQueueInterface

      • insert

        public void insert(java.lang.Object o)
        Inserts an object into the rear of the queue. Handles resizing the queue if the queue is full.
        Specified by:
        insert in interface ObjectQueueInterface
        Parameters:
        o - Object that will wait in the queue

      • remove

        public java.lang.Object remove()
        Removes the object at the front of the queue and returns it. Handles resizing the queue if the number of elements is one-fourth the size of the queue.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface ObjectQueueInterface
        Returns:
        Object that was in the front of the queue

      • query

        public java.lang.Object query()
        Returns the object that resides at the front of the queue. Quits the system if the queue experiences an underflow.
        Specified by:
        query in interface ObjectQueueInterface
        Returns:
        Object at the front of the queue

      • resize

        private void resize(int size)
        Handles resizing of the queue's array to the given size.
        Parameters:
        size - New size of the queue array
